intro: Stenogyne recta, commonly known as the narrow-mouthed plant, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in native forests and on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
